headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: UnitedHealth, Alibaba, Rivian, Celsius, Booking, Block, Akamai, Hims & Hers, and More
summary: UnitedHealth declines following a report that the Justice Department has been investigating the company’s Medicare billing practices, a report says GameStop CEO Ryan Cohen has boosted his stake in Alibaba to $1 billion, and Rivian’s outlook disappoints, sending shares lower.

headline: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Akamai Leads Losses Amid Broad Market Selloff
summary: The S&P 500 plunged by 1.7% on Friday, Feb. 21, as weak economic data and earnings forecasts sent the benchmark index lower for the second straight session.

raw.headline: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Akamai Leads Losses Amid Broad Market Selloff

headline: Why Akamai (AKAM) Stock Is Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of web content delivery and security company Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) fell 20.3% in the afternoon session after the company reported weak fourth-quarter 2024 results, with next year's revenue guidance signaling a sharp deceleration in demand and falling short of Wall Street's estimates. Revenue grew just 3% year on year with security and compute solutions delivering double-digit growth, but these gains were overshadowed by an 18% drop in delivery revenue, the segment that historically generat

headline: Akamai Stock Heads for Biggest Loss in 8 Years
summary: The cloud-services firm projected 2025 revenue between $4 billion and $4.20 billion, below the average Wall Street estimate of $4.26 billion.

headline: Akamai Technologies Stock Leads S&P 500 Decliners Following Weak Outlook
summary: Shares of Akamai Technologies tumbled 20% to lead S&P 500 decliners Friday, as weaker-than-expected forecasts outweighed better-than-expected fourth-quarter results.
